radiographic_examinations.findings: Echogenic portal triads throughout the liver suggestive of periportal edema. No focal liver lesions or textural abnormality. No evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary duct dilation. The common bile duct measures 2 mm. The gallbladder wall is thickened and edematous, distended, and contains several small gallstones. A positive sonographic ___ sign was present. The spleen measures 9.6 cm and is unremarkable. The pancreas is unremarkable without evidence of focal lesions or pancreatic duct dilation. The portal vein is patent and demonstrates normal hepatopedal flow.
